title: Lockdown: The teacher using pavements as blackboards
description: A mother of five spreads her knowledge of plants and trees by chalking names on local pavements.

title: Week in pictures: 18-24 April 2020
description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

title: Eurovision Again: Why fans of the song contest get together every Saturday
description: Fans of the song contest are re-watching old competitions as "a distraction from all the bad stuff".

title: Coronavirus: 'Revenge porn' surge hits helpline
description: The government-funded Revenge Porn Helpline has been busier than ever since the lockdown started.

title: Coronavirus: Has Sweden got its science right?
description: The strategy devised by scientists was to keep large parts of society open but not everyone is convinced.

title: Coronavirus: The celebrity cash giveaway and other stories fact-checked
description: Unpicking the week's dubious claims including a fake cash giveaway and a Covid-19 "remedy".

title: The celebrities striking the right note by spreading comfort and joy
description: Not all stars have come off well, but some are providing positivity, humour and a human touch.

title: Coronavirus: Dancer uses bin night to perform for neighbours
description: Albert has not been able to dance freely, but that changed the moment he embraced taking the rubbish out as an act of freedom - and a gift to his new neighbours.

title: Coronavirus: Why going without physical touch is so hard
description: Touch is the first sense humans develop in the womb - is that why so many are finding lockdown difficult?

title: Coronavirus: Should I worry about my lockdown eating?
description: Weeks of lockdown is putting a strain on some people's relationship with food.

title: Coronavirus: Transport usage will change after lockdown
description: Public transport usage won't recover to pre-Covid19 levels once the lockdown ends, a survey suggests.

title: Coronavirus: 'Homeless' struggle to social distance
description: People living in shared accommodation are concerned about how they stay safe.

title: Colombia: Saving rare species in jungles once protected by war
description: Botanists from Kew are combing the forests of Colombia for new species threatened with extinction since peace accords were signed.

title: Insurers estimate virus payouts to UK firms to be £1.2bn
description: Early estimate from insurance group says £900m will go to businesses with specialist policies.

title: Nova Scotia shooting: 'They had no idea the hell they were going to face'
description: Canada's deadliest shooting is pieced together by the people swept up in its path of terror.

title: ePremier League Invitational Fifa 20: I only want a Messi shirt, says Raheem Sterling
description: Manchester City's Raheem Sterling says the only shirt he wants before he retires is Lionel Messi's.

title: Coronavirus: Test website closes after 'significant demand'
description: Up to 10 million key workers and their households are eligible to book a test for coronavirus.

title: Brexit: Disappointing progress in trade talks, says Michel Barnier
description: The EU's chief negotiator warns that the "clock is ticking" following another round of talks.

title: Coronavirus: Doreen Lawrence to head Labour probe on minorities
description: Baroness Doreen Lawrence, Labour's new race relations adviser, is heading the investigation.

title: Coronavirus: Disinfectant firm issues warning after Trump comments
description: The makers of Lysol and Dettol warn against Donald Trump's suggestion of ingesting disinfectant.

title: Hubble telescope delivers stunning 30th birthday picture
description: The veteran telescope celebrates three decades in orbit with a colourful image of star formation.

title: Alex Scott column: 'We didn't see Phil Neville's philosophy adapt'
description: In Alex Scott's BBC Sport column, she discusses where it went wrong for departing England manager Phil Neville and who could be his replacement.

title: Players may face choice over women's Rugby World Cup or Olympic Games in 2021
description: Players may have to choose between the Olympic Games and the women’s Rugby World Cup in 2021 after World Rugby confirmed the tournament dates will not change.

title: Big Night In: 11 highlights from BBC's £27m fundraiser
description: Prince William, Doctor Who and Miranda joined comedians and musicians on the TV fundraising special.

title: Coronavirus: Transport for London furloughs 7,000 staff
description: London's transport commissioner says fare revenues have plummeted by 90% during the pandemic.

title: Coronavirus: Frozen airline food mountain to feed those in need
description: Disadvantaged people across Greater Manchester will receive meals intended for air passengers.

title: Shoppers swap clothes for alcohol amid record sales drop
description: Shopping declines at the steepest pace since the Office for National Statistics started collecting data.

title: Neville confirms England departure in July 2021
description: Phil Neville says there is "plenty to work on" as it is confirmed he will leave his role as England women's manager in July 2021.

title: England v West Indies postponed as season delayed until 1 July
description: England's Test series against West Indies is postponed as the shutdown on cricket in England and Wales is extended until at least 1 July.

title: Coronavirus: 'Traffic light' system to lift lockdown in Wales
description: First minister says some restrictions could be eased at end of current three-week lockdown period.

title: Coronavirus: What is contact tracing and how does it work?
description: When lockdown ends, contact tracing could help limit the spread of coronavirus.

title: The trailblazing Olympic marathon champion still breaking boundaries in her 60s
description: Joan Benoit Samuelson was the first woman to win Olympic marathon gold and this Sunday would have seen her reach another landmark at the London Marathon.

title: Uncertainty causing pregnant women distress
description: Women say the uncertainty during the coronavirus outbreak is "making a stressful situation harder".

title: Quarterback Burrow first pick for Bengals in NFL draft
description: Joe Burrow says it is a "dream come true" after being selected first by the Cincinnati Bengals in the 2020 NFL draft.

title: Coronavirus: Wacky and wonderful scrubs for NHS workers
description: Hundreds of volunteers are making scrubs of all different designs and colours for doctors and nurses.

title: Owen Harding: The teen who disappeared during lockdown
description: The story of the 16-year-old who went missing, and the community who tried to find him.

title: ‘Like a clenched fist’ – how artists are depicting the lockdown
description: British sculptor Sir Antony Gormley is among the artists sharing work from home during the health crisis.
